channel.title: Shashank Rajiv Moghe
channel.description: Recent content on Shashank Rajiv Moghe

item.title: SolarMobil
item.description:
Note: This writeup was copied from my old website, which no is longer functional.

SolarMobil is a student project under Manipal Institute of Technology which focuses on building and manufacturing an solar powered electric car for ESVC.

ESVC is Asia’s biggest solar car event, Except for the motors and wheels (which are proprietary) they build everything else from scratch. The sheer amount of design work that goes into the project is phenomenal. I was a member of the automation subsystem, meaning my work was focused around getting the car to autonomously navigate through one of the challenges in the competition. The challenge was to navigate the car completely autonomously through a course marked by having small orange cones on both sides. The design limitations on it were that the coded stack needed to be cheap, easy to use and understand and for initial setup use only a RGB camera. Of course, the stack needed to integrate with the rest of the car in terms of mechanical and electronics design.

item.title: Ackermann Drive Simulation
item.description:
Note: This writeup was copied from my old website, which no is longer functional.

The challenge is to get a cone following algorithm to be implemented using just a normal RGB camera. The competition this was made for is the same as (TODO Link SolarMobil work) I used the linearity of the relation of area occupied on screen vs. the distance of the object. I get a representation of the distance here rather than the actual physical distance with this method. The scikit-spatial library is a huge help as it simplifies a lot of the involved mathematics.
